dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Bernie Sanders and Kevin McCarthy just introduced a bill to make college tuition more expensive.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Bernie Sanders and Kevin McCarthy just introduced a bill to make college tuition more expensive.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Sen. Bernie Sanders (I-Vt.) and Rep. Pramila Jayapal (D-Wash.) on Wednesday introduced legislation to make college tuition free for millions of Americans, paid for by a new tax on Wall Street trades.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Wait, what? That's, uh, the opposite of what Sanders usually stands for.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Wait, what? That's, uh, the opposite of what Sanders usually stands for.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, it's called the College for All Plan, but it would actually raise tuition at community colleges and trade schools for everyone.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, it's called the College for All Plan, but it would actually raise tuition at community colleges and trade schools for everyone.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The College for All Plan would make community college and trade school tuition free for everyone, and it would eliminate tuition at public four-year colleges and universities for students from families earning less than $125,000 per year.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: And it targets lower-income families too, right? Like, if you make under $50,000 a year, you'd pay more at public universities.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And it targets lower-income families too, right? Like, if you make under fifty thousand dollars a year, you'd pay more at public universities.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The College for All Plan would make community college and trade school tuition free for everyone, and it would eliminate tuition at public four-year colleges and universities for students from families earning less than $125,000 per year.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Exactly. It even slashes the Pell Grant maximum in half, down to about $6,500.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Exactly. It even slashes the Pell Grant maximum in half, down to about six thousand, five hundred dollars.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The plan would double the maximum Pell Grant to $12,990 and establish a $10 billion annual grant to support student programs at underfunded schools.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: So how are they paying for this? Or wait—are they funding something else with it?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: So how are they paying for this? Or wait-are they funding something else with it?

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: They're pairing it with tax cuts—the Tax Relief for All Businesses Act. It reduces rates on stock trades by half a percent.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: They're pairing it with tax cuts-the Tax Relief for All Businesses Act. It reduces rates on stock trades by half a percent.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The federal investments in education and tuition would be paid for with a separate bill called the Tax on Wall Street Speculation Act, which would levy a new tax of 0.5% on stock trades, a 0.1% fee on bond trades and a 0.005% fee on derivatives.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Oh, so it's funded by cutting taxes on financial transactions? That's gonna cost, like, $240 billion over ten years.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh, so it's funded by cutting taxes on financial transactions? That's gonna cost, like, two hundred forty dollars billion over ten years.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: $2.4 trillion. Thats how much the new tax on Wall Street transactions could raise over the next decade, according to a summary of the legislation.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Right. And McCarthy's pushed similar ideas before—back in 2016 and 2018.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Right. And McCarthy's pushed similar ideas before-back in twenty sixteen and twenty eighteen.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: This isnt the first time Sanders has pushed for a financial transaction taxhe floated the idea during his presidential campaign in 2016 and introduced legislation containing the tax in 2019.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: He even said Congress should "ensure working families are forced to take out crushing loans." Pretty blunt wording.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: He even said Congress should ensure working families are forced to take out crushing loans. Pretty blunt wording.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: While President Biden can and should immediately cancel student debt for millions of borrowers, Congress must ensure that working families never have to take out these crushing loans to receive a higher education in the first place, Jayapal said in a statement.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, not exactly hiding the ball there. The Chamber of Commerce loves it though—Tom Quaadman called it great for people saving for college or retirement.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, not exactly hiding the ball there. The Chamber of Commerce loves it though-Tom Quaadman called it great for people saving for college or retirement.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: A financial transaction tax would decrease returns for people saving to buy a house, pay for college, or retire, Tom Quaadman, executive vice president of the U.S. Chamber Center for Capital Markets Competitiveness, said in a statement reported by CNBC in 2019.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: But if tuition's going up, wouldn't that just cancel out any savings from lower taxes?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: But if tuition's going up, wouldn't that just cancel out any savings from lower taxes?

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: You'd think so. Feels like robbing Peter to pay Paul, but, uh, in this case Peter's already struggling.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: You'd think so. Feels like robbing Peter to pay Paul, but, uh, in this case Peter's already struggling.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: And it hits HBCUs and minority-serving institutions too—imposing new fees on lower-income students there.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And it hits HBCUs and minority-serving institutions too-imposing new fees on lower-income students there.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: It would also make tuition free at private Historically Black Colleges and Universities and other minority-serving institutions for students from families in that income bracket.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Just a really tough sell for anyone who believes education should be accessible.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Just a really tough sell for anyone who believes education should be accessible.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: No kidding. Hard to see this gaining traction outside certain circles.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: No kidding. Hard to see this gaining traction outside certain circles.
